titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Javier Pérez de Cuéllar Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by the Political Science Department and Manuscripts and Archives staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:14

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of photocopies of United Nations documents used in the writing of Javier Pérez de Cuéllar's memoirs, Pilgrimage for Peace: A Secretary-General's Memoir. His biography recounts his two terms as United Nations Secretary-General, focusing on those issues and countries with which he had the largest personal involvement.

langmaterial.language: The papers are in English, French, Spanish, and Russian.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Javier Javier Pérez de Cuéllar, 2000.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Javier Pérez de Cuéllar Papers (MS 1768). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Javier Pérez de Cuéllar was born on January 19, 1920 in Peru. Upon completion of his law studies in 1944, he entered the Peruvian career diplomatic service, serving on the delegation to the Preparatory Commission of the United Nations and in a variety of capacities in the foreign ministry in Lima. He also served as ambassador to Switzerland in 1962 and to the Soviet Union in 1968. In 1970 he became the Permanent Representative of Peru in the United Nations and served twice as President of the Security Council. In 1975 he became the Special Representative for Cyprus. He was recalled by his government in 1977 to serve as ambassador to Venezuela and in 1979 assumed the post of Under-Secretary-General for Special Political Affairs at the United Nations. He was elected Secretary-General of the United Nations in 1982, serving two terms until 1992. Javier Pérez de Cuéllar is the author of Pilgrimage for Peace: A Secretary-General's Memoir.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of photocopies of United Nations documents used in the writing of Javier Pérez de Cuéllar's memoirs, Pilgrimage for Peace: A Secretary-General's Memoir. His biography recounts his two terms as United Nations Secretary-General, focusing on those issues and countries with which he had the largest personal involvement.

controlaccess.subject: Falkland Islands War, 1982
Statesmen -- Peru
controlaccess.geogname: Latin America -- Politics and government -- 20th Century

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Javier Pérez de Cuéllar Papers consist of photocopies of United Nations documents used in the writing of Pilgrimage for Peace. The photocopies include reports of the General Assembly and the Security Council, briefing notes, summaries of meetings with officials of numerous countries, and related items. The listing parallels the arrangement of the chapters in the book, beginning with Part Two, "The Middle East and Beyond" through Part V, "Restoring Peace on Two Continents." Miscellaneous files are included at the end of the collection.

did.unittitle: Part Two: The Middle East and Beyond
Lebanon/UNIFIL [United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]
"Working for a Middle East Peace Settlement" [chapter four]
United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA)
United Nations Department of Public Information (UNDOF)
Middle East attack on Iraqi nuclear installation
Special Advisor on Economic Development in Occupied Palestinian Territories (Francis Blanchard)
International Conference on the Question of Palestine
Conversation with Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher about Cyprus
Part three: Africa: A Continent of Triumph and Travail
Namibia, South Africa, Angola, trips to [Aug 22-28]
Namibia [secretary-general messages, statements, and days of solidarity]
"Angola and Mozambique: Countries in Crisis" [chapter twelve]
South African mission to protect UNITA
Special coordination for emergency relief operations in Angola
United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara (MINURSO)]
Part four: War and Peace in Latin America
"The Falklands/Malvinas: A Nineteenth-Century War in the Twentieth Century" [chapter fourteen]
Statements of United Kingdom and Argentine positions
"The Path to Peace in Central America" [chapter fifteen]
Conversation with James Baker on Nicaragua [Feb 2]
United Nations Observer Group in Central America (ONUCA)
Part five: Restoring Peace on Two Continents
Notes of the secretary-general's meeting with the special representative for humanitarian affairs in the Southeast
Notes of the secretary-general's meeting with the minister of foreign affairs to Indonesia
Paris meeting with Supreme National Council [Jan 8]
Final statement of United Nations Transitional Authority in Cambodia (UNTAC)
UN contacts with the Soviet Union
Secretary-general's meeting with Vice President Quayle [Dec 11]
